benchmark_details.name: L3Cube-MahaParaphrase Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The L3Cube-MahaParaphrase Dataset is a robust Marathi paraphrase corpus consisting of 8,000 labeled pairs of sentences classified as either Paraphrase (P) or Non-paraphrase (NP), divided into five buckets based on varying degrees of paraphrastic and non-paraphrastic relationships.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the L3Cube-MahaParaphrase Dataset is to provide a valuable resource for researchers and practitioners to advance further research in Marathi NLP.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Compared to paraphrase datasets for high-resource languages, this dataset is relatively small (8K pairs).

data.source: The dataset was created from the MahaCorpus dataset, incorporating data through manual verification and annotation processes.
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts as either Paraphrase (P) or Non-paraphrase (NP), with verification by native Marathi speakers.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as accuracy and F1 score are calculated based on the model evaluation on the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: An F1 score of 88.7% indicates a high level of accuracy in paraphrase detection.
methodology.baseline_results: MahaBERT achieved an F1 score of 88.7%, the highest among evaluated models.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through manual corrections by native annotators.
